ratings.comment: If you can, take the class with Dr. Block. Dr. Trate is a nice lady, but her lectures were useless and I just ended up watching Block's online. Like someone else said, she repeats the textbook but worse and will restate what she just said instead of actually answering questions. *Mandatory attendance only for most dis and labs

Prof. Trate would constantly be behind in lecture, and would often rush through important material, but I struggled to grasp some more difficult stuff. I would have taken Dr. Block for 109 if I had known how inconsistent and rushed her lectures were. Her grading was relatively easy/average, and she gives good feedback if you go to office hours.
Trate seemed like she was a caring person, but my god could she not explain things. I did not understand her lectures at all and she was just unable to answer questions despite trying.
Clearly conveyed material and provided adequate support when needed. Loved the perspective she took on Chemistry. Would take again.

Professor Trate is very welcoming, friendly, and often cracks jokes in lectures. The lecture material often repeated and specified most things from the readings. Although sufficient, many considered Professor Block's recorded lectures online to be a bit more in depth.

Lectures were usually an exact repeat of the readings vs an expansion, she spends too much time reexplaining one topic, and will post 20+ slides per lecture and maybe get through 7, which is frustrating as we don't get to the actually confusing content. Dr. Block's lectures (posted online) made way more sense and are much more interactive.

Overall, I found her lectures to be ineffective. She reads off slides containing the same textbook information, yet we still get behind quite frequently. Additionally, she can be hard to reach when it comes to accommodations. After watching the other professors' lectures, I started doing better in this class.

She was very nice, and made an effort to talk to students and understand their needs. However, she was not good at explaining complex chemistry topics, and used a lot of scientific language that people in an introductory chemistry course would not understand. I found watching Professor Block's recorded lectures were much more helpful.

As others said, Dr. Trate wasn't the best at explaining hard topics. Many of my classmates would skip her lectures and watch the recorded lectures by Dr. Block. She is a very nice lady, however, and encouraged students to come to her office hours for help or to hang out. I asked her questions one-on-one and she was patient and even learned my name.

She was knowledgeable about the topics she would talk about, but her explanations were horrendous. She would always use random scientific jargon without explanation leaving the entire class lost. Also, many times someone asked a question she got visibly mad. Still, she was always prepared every class even if everyone was lost - this gets her a 2.
Dr. Trate was so kind and approachable, and clear, concise, and knowledgeable. Would definitely take again.

She wasn't unknowledgeable about the material, but her ability to explain difficult topics was horrendous. Also, during lecture, she talks/writes so fast that I took pictures before she moved on. When I watched the other professor's lecture, I understood the content 10x better. I think that with a different professor, I would've struggled less.

This was Dr. Trate's first time teaching this class, and she did a good job. Her lectures were not particularly interesting, but she didn't just read off slides. She was clear, concise, and the content of the lecture clarified what we read in the textbook well. The course as a whole was very well laid out, and it was quite easy to get help.
